page.title: 04ST.BRONAGH'S BELL
page.content: There was once a chieftain called Fergus who lived in County Down.He was out hunting one day when he met Artan a neighbour.They quarrelled and fought.Fergus thought that he had killed Artan so he bought a bell and offered it to the Convent which at that time was at the Crag.This was an act of penance and he became a pilgrim. For about a thousand years,long after the building became derelict,the bell was still heard from time to time. No one knew where the sound came from. In 1885 a large oak tree which stood near the old church was blown down in a storm and inside the rotted tree was part of St.Bronagh's bell. It is now used in the Star of the Sea Church in Rostrevor.
